pr_title: [RW-3062][risk=no] Fix "Aou" and "All of Us" text across workbench

timeline.message: RW-3062 fix non-italicized All of Us text
RW-3062 spell out and italicize AoU text

timeline.bodyText: [no action needed] I've used React.ReactNode for type-annotating in similar scenarios (code). This seems maybe more specific / appropriate, but React.ReactNode may make it possible to avoid wrapping plain-text descriptions in  elements to satisfy the type-checker. Either way, we should probably aim to eventually make our type usage consistent here, and/or clarify when to use one vs. the other.
timeline.author: gjuggler

replies.bodyText: Nice idea. I went ahead and switched to React.ReactNode for the reason you mentioned. Now the description can be a string or element.
replies.author: dolbeew

timeline.message: RW-3062 switch registration task descriptions to type React.ReactNode
